main event: In March 1956, a series of unidentified flying object sightings were reported across various locations in the United States, particularly in Philadelphia and Cincinnati.
interesting points: The case in Philadelphia involved a sighting of a single unidentified object that appeared star-like and dimmed as it receded., Witnesses in Cincinnati reported seeing bright objects in the sky that some speculated might be something other than Venus., Captain William T. Dunn, an experienced pilot, reported seeing an oval, shiny metallic object that changed course sharply., Observations in Lansing, Michigan described a close encounter with a 'flying saucer' that hovered near a river., Sightings reported during this period led to significant public interest and were documented by Project Blue Book.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects including an angular luminous object and possibly bright celestial phenomena
witness description: Civilians and experienced aviation professionals, including pilots and technicians
